intro: Diderotia, commonly known as the "dwarf maple," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Sapindaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are small shrubs or trees native to Southeast Asia. The plants are characterized by their opposite, simple leaves that are often palmately lobed. Diderotia species produce small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. The fruits are dry, dehiscent capsules that release small, winged seeds.
